text: I am a PhD candidate in the Pekosz Lab at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health in the department of Molecular Microbiology and Immunology. I study the interface between respiratory viruses and the human nasal epithelial cell barrier.

title: About Me
text:
My interests include:

Genomic surveillance of influenza viruses.
The Phenotypic consequences of Influenza B non-structural protein evolution.
Bioinformatic tool development for assessing influenza genomic evolution.
The development of primary models to interrogate viral determinants of host disease.
